items.title: Fursen
items.content:
Fursen

Race: Leonin | Class: Monk (Open Hand) | Level: 10

Who He Is

Fursen is a Leonin monk â€” a lion-like humanoid who follows the Way of the Open Hand. He joined the party after they freed him from temporal imprisonment during the 13-Hour Trial. He is one of the last surviving Leonin â€” a species that was exterminated over a thousand years ago.

The Temporal Prison

Fursen was trapped in one of Imhuran's temporal cells, frozen outside of time. The party's actions during the 13-Hour Trial freed him â€” but they also learned that four other Leonin remain trapped in similar cells somewhere.

The 10,000 Names

Fursen's blood carries the memory of 10,000 Leonin ancestors. At the Mouth of the World â€” the vast depression where Vor'Kael waits â€” his ancestors' names screamed in recognition. In the presence of the Satiated One, they fell silent for the first time, quiet before something so ancient.

The Ledger of Moments

When the party visited Thessaly at the Frayed Codex in Veinspire, Fursen begged for The Ledger of Moments â€” a heavy tome bound in clockwork with tiny gears still turning in the cover. Thessaly gave it to him for free, with a promise:

"Come back someday. Tell me how your quest concludes."

The Ledger contains a partial transcription of Imhuran's temporal records â€” names, crimes, sentences. It updates itself: new names appear, old names vanish. Most importantly, it contains Leonin history, including information about Fursen's mother Vaelith.

Sekris's Contract-Token

In Lastwell, after Fursen betrayed Jonas (giving his name to the identity-stealing husks) and Jonas retaliated (throwing the Bleeding Blade into Fursen's thigh), a meaning-dealer named Sekris approached Fursen with a smoke-grey coin.

Breaking the coin summons Sekris to arrange for meanings to be "removed." The implication: Fursen could arrange for Jonas's death. The deal is not yet made â€” Fursen holds the token but hasn't broken it.

Key Moments

  • Freed from temporal imprisonment during the 13-Hour Trial
  • Gave a pale lifespan coin to the Misremembered
  • Received the Ledger of Moments from Thessaly
  • Witnessed Kael and Mira's deaths in the Catacomb Reliquary
  • Carried Mira's remains in a barrel through the Blooming Rot
  • Completed the quest to reunite Mira with Elias
  • Betrayed Jonas in Lastwell by giving his name to the husks
  • Stabbed twice by Jonas (Bleeding Blade + Booming Blade)
  • Received contract-token from Sekris the meaning-dealer
  • Pulled Sol back from the Door of Possibility
  • Reconciled with Jonas at the tavern in Lastwell (accepted medical kit and 100 gold)
  • Talked the guards into letting the party wait in Ardian's quarters (Nat 20)
  • Learned from Thessaly that Ultharion is tracking him via Leonin records
  • Lost two wisdom teeth to the Hollow Crawler's Consume Feature
  • Received diamond teeth from Thresh, paying in story (names from the 10,000)
  • Confessed to Jonas about secretly applying Moonbind Salve â€” was forgiven
  • Fought the Smoldering Remnant in The Hollow
  • Witnessed Jonas's death â€” fled with Sol

Being Hunted

Thessaly realized the truth when the party mentioned Ultharion searching Leonin records:

Ultharion is tracking the party through Fursen â€” the last surviving Leonin who moves openly through the world is easy to trace.

The Hollow Crawler's Theft

During the ambush on Day 8, the Hollow Crawler's Consume Feature dissolved two of Fursen's wisdom teeth. He discovered the loss at dawn and wept â€” grief for the teeth, for everything taken, for being the last Leonin.

In Crownfall, Thresh replaced them with diamond teeth, anchored to the jawbone. Permanent, functional, capable of biting through leather.

Current Status

Fursen is on the beach outside The Hollow, having just fled the dungeon after Jonas's death. He now has diamond wisdom teeth. He carries the Ledger of Moments, the weight of 10,000 ancestors in his blood, Sekris's contract-token (unused), and Cinder's copper scale (a token from his night at the Silken Refuge). His relationship with Jonas was mended â€” hours before Jonas died. Their last exchange was one of reconciliation. Ultharion is still tracking him.

items.title: Sol Raven
items.content:
Sol Raven

Race: Skeleton (God-Woken) | Class: Sorcerer | Level: 10

Who He Is

Sol Raven is not alive in the traditional sense. He is a skeleton â€” bare bones animated by a shard of divine essence from Aedwynn the Maker, the god who was murdered to create the Sovereigns. He wears robes and a hood to hide his nature from the living.

He has no memory of who he was before he woke up as bones. He doesn't know how he died, why Aedwynn saved him, or if the thoughts in his skull are truly his own.

The Maker's Witness

In, after the party killed Kaleth, they found a hidden chamber called the Chamber of the Final Breath. A white-barked tree with veins of gold rose from the stone, and at its base sat Aedwynn's preserved body â€” a shell containing an echo of her consciousness. When the party touched her, she awakened. Sol was recognized as carrying a piece of the Maker, and he accepted the role of Witness â€” the Maker's heir, carrying her memory forward.

He can now access complete memories of the world before the Usurpation, share memories through touch, and create permanent objects from nothing. Divine abilities from a source that predates the Sovereigns.

Clockmaker's Touch

During the 13-Hour Trial, Sol traded a personal memory for a temporal ability called Clockmaker's Touch. He's still learning what it can do.

Infected with Possibility

In the Concept Graveyard within Vor'Kael's Throat, Sol opened the Door of Possibility. He saw every version of himself he could have been â€” Sol with flesh and breath, older Sol surrounded by grandchildren, Sol as a respected mage, a thousand Sols who asked "Why did you become THIS instead of US?"

Fursen pulled him back and the door slammed shut, but the Possibilities poured in. Sol is now infected with unlived lives:

  • Disadvantage on Wisdom saves until purged or accepted
  • Once per day, can ask "What would have happened if...?" about a past decision and receive a true answer
  • Whispers of unlived lives grow louder in moments of doubt or regret
  • Unknown long-term effects

In the presence of the Satiated One, the whispers went silent â€” the first silence since the infection.

The Remembrance Seal

Sol retrieved a Remembrance Seal from a skeleton in Vor'Kael's bile pools â€” a woman who almost escaped 800 years ago, dissolving inches from freedom. The black iron pendant grants advantage on saves against memory alteration and contains her final memory.

Key Moments

  • Hired as escort to Veinspire with Jonas
  • Sensed divine resonance in the corrupted church catacombs
  • Ascended for the first time in a floating village on a river of blood
  • Traded a memory for Clockmaker's Touch during the 13-Hour Trial
  • Touched Aedwynn's body and became the Witness
  • Showed Talaris Bloomrend a vision of the Maker alive
  • Placed Mira's wedding ring on her finger in the Cave of Waiting
  • Retrieved the Remembrance Seal from the Throat's bile pools
  • Opened the Door of Possibility and became infected with unlived lives
  • Nearly lost Kael's Echo when the Codex tried to throw itself into Vor'Kael's Mouth
  • Discovered Vor'Kael's scout footprints circling camp during his watch
  • Found Ultharion's vessel tools in Ardian's quarters
  • Reported Savaros's death to Thessaly â€” "Two thousand years she survived. And a Skin-Walker..."
  • Discovered the Hollow Crawler's handprints during night watch
  • Communed with Velara Ashyn's soul in the amulet
  • Purchased a Cloak of Protection in Crownfall
  • Learned from the Docent that the passion-seed is the original â€” the first cutting from Aedwynn's Left Heart
  • Velara agreed to guide the purification of the passion-seed
  • Entered The Hollow seeking Oathbreaker's End
  • Witnessed Jonas's death â€” fled with Fursen

Possibility Infection â€” Worsening

The whispers of unlived lives are growing louder. Sol has been caught twice standing motionless, muttering about paths not taken. It takes longer to snap out each time.

He still has disadvantage on all Wisdom saves.

Current Status

Sol is on the beach outside The Hollow, having just fled the dungeon after Jonas's death. He carries the Resonant Codex (containing Kael's Echo), the Remembrance Seal, a Cloak of Protection, and the Soul Anchor Amulet containing Velara Ashyn's consciousness. The Possibility infection continues. He carries the weight of a quest that just got harder â€” and Velara still needs a place where the Maker's touch lingers. Velara recognized something in him: "...there's something inside you too..."

items.title: Jonas
items.content:
Jonas

Race: Human | Class: Fighter (Eldritch Knight) | Level: 10

Who He Is

Jonas is a cocky warrior who genuinely enjoys violence. He's good at fighting and he knows it â€” and he's not shy about letting others know it too. His brash confidence often clashes with the cosmic forces the party keeps stumbling into, but that doesn't stop him from swinging first and asking questions later.

The Bleeding Blade

Jonas carries a cursed longsword called The Bleeding Blade â€” a weapon that hungers. It must be fed blood daily or it turns on its wielder. The sword whispers to him sometimes. He's learned to manage the curse, but managing isn't the same as controlling.

Marked Twice

Jonas bears two divine marks:

  • Azerach's Brand â€” The Whispered King marked him during their passage through the Silent Dominion. The brand burns when secrets are spoken nearby. Through this brand, Azerach opened the Closed Locket and revealed Vor'Kael's true name.
  • Talaris's Attention â€” After using fire in the Blooming Rot, the Verdant King took notice. The forest remembers what he burned.

Vor'Kael's True Name

Jonas holds Vor'Kael's true name â€” the name she had before the Usurpation, kept secret by Azerach for 800 years. He acquired it from a Closed Locket purchased in Lastwell â€” sealed with strong magic, opened by Azerach through the brand. This is ultimate leverage against the Hollow Empress.

The cost: Jonas spoke her true name aloud once â€” to command passage from the Satiated One. Vor'Kael will hunt him forever for this transgression.

Key Moments

  • Hired alongside Sol as escorts to Veinspire
  • Survived the 13-Hour Trial in the Clockwork Sanctum
  • Claimed the Bleeding Blade from the Altar after killing Savaros
  • Watched Kael die in the Catacomb Reliquary
  • Traveled through the Blooming Rot (Fursen carried Mira's remains in a barrel)
  • Lied to the Choir Blooms and was marked for it
  • Stabbed Fursen twice after being betrayed (then reconciled)
  • Acquired Vor'Kael's true name from the Closed Locket
  • Saved Kael's Echo by catching the Codex at the Mouth of the World
  • Traversed the Throat of Forgotten Things
  • Discovered Vor'Kael's scout had found his camp â€” she knows his location
  • Buried the Bleeding Blade outside Veinspire's walls (stolen Church property)
  • Shook Ardian Bloodveil's hand with his branded palm â€” Ardian recognized Azerach's mark
  • Acquired Azerach pact materials from Thessaly
  • Summoned the Bleeding Blade outside Veinspire â€” Ardian sensed it
  • Killed the Hollow Crawler tracking the party (triggered Vor'Kael's Eyes)
  • Found the passion-seed and soul anchor amulet in the Bone Field
  • Commissioned a shield from Custodian armplate at Broma's Forge
  • Forgave Fursen for drugging him with Moonbind Salve
  • Entered The Hollow seeking Oathbreaker's End
  • ðŸ’€ Killed by the Smoldering Remnant in Session 23

Considering a Warlock Pact

Jonas asked Thessaly about making a pact with Azerach. She warned him that he's "already his" â€” the brand means Azerach sees and hears through him. A formal pact would grant power over silence, the ability to steal words from throats, to move without sound. But warlocks of the Whispered King fade â€” people forget they're in the room, conversations move past them. They become background. Unnoticed. Unremembered.

Thessaly gave Jonas materials to study: a book on pact theory and a scroll with ritual instructions from a warlock who "faded."

The Pulsehammer

When Jonas showed the pulsehammer to Broma (a smith who worked Kaedris's heart-forges), her reaction was terror:

She demanded he never bring it back to her shop, out of the district, out of Crownfall.

Death

Session 23 â€” The Hollow

Jonas fell to the Smoldering Remnant in the depths of The Hollow. The spectral smith's hammer caught him square â€” three blows in rapid succession. His body hit the ankle-deep water. The Bleeding Blade slipped from his fingers.

His last meaningful exchange was one of reconciliation â€” Fursen had confessed to drugging him with Moonbind Salve, and Jonas had chosen to forgive. Hours later, he was dead.

Fursen and Sol fled the Hollow, leaving behind:

  • The Bleeding Blade â€” now ownerless, still hungry
  • Ring of Alertness
  • Pulsehammer
  • Vor'Kael's True Name â€” the most dangerous item, now unguarded
  • Moonbind Salve (6 doses)

Final Status

ðŸ’€ DECEASED â€” Jonas's body lies in the forge chamber of The Hollow. The Smoldering Remnant still guards the room. His gear, including Vor'Kael's true name, remains with his body. The Hollow preserves â€” the cold water and isolation mean his body won't decay quickly. There may still be time to retrieve it.

items.title: Azerach the Whispered King
items.content:
AZERACH THE WHISPERED KING

The Sovereign of Secrets and Silence Domain: Unknown

What the Party Knows

Jonas's Brand

Jonas bears Azerach's brand on his palm - a mark of servitude or claim placed upon him against his will. The Bone Wardens recognized this brand as a claim of loyalty, regardless of the bearer's intent. The brand marks Jonas as belonging to Azerach.

When offered the chance by the Maker's fragment to "deal with the curse placed upon him," Jonas explicitly refused - choosing to bear the brand rather than seek its removal.

The Doctrine of Still Air

Sol read "The Doctrine of Still Air" - a cautionary religious text describing one of Azerach's worshippers who gained power over silence and stillness but lost the ability to speak, becoming frozen in silence forever. The text serves as a warning about the cost of pursuing Azerach's gifts.

Direct Intervention

During the battle with Savaros the Skin-Walker, Azerach directly intervened - creating a barrier that saved Jonas from being consumed. The Whispered King protects his "pawn."
items.raw: Azerach the Whispered King Overview Azerach the Whispered King controls air and breath itself. Before the Usurpation, he was a historian-priest devoted to truth and forbidden knowledge. During the murder of Aedwynn, he claimed the Maker's Lungs and sealed his own mouth forever - he would only listen, never speak. He hears all sounds within 30 miles and collects every secret ever whispered. Jonas carries his brand, making Jonas his unwitting messenger Mythic Trait: Ears of the Maker When Azerach is reduced to 0 hit points, his body doesn't die. Instead, it explodes into thousands of flying, bat-like ears that scatter in all directions, each one shrieking silently. These ears have AC 25, 80 HP each, immunity to psychic damage, and a fly speed of 60 feet. They flee to hide throughout his domain. Over the next 2d10 days, the ears gradually congregate and reform into Azerach at full hit points. If fewer than 100 ears survive, Azerach reforms but is weakened (half hit points, -5 to all DCs). Only by destroying every single ear or destroying Azerach's preserved Lungs (his actual divine organ) can he be permanently killed. The Lungs are hidden somewhere in the deepest part of his domain and have AC 28, 500 HP, and immunity to all damage except radiant and force. Lore & Background Before the Usurpation, Azerach was a historian-priest in a temple devoted to truth and forbidden knowledge. His order forbade lying above all else, believing deception was the greatest sin. But Azerach discovered something his fellows had not: truth could be weaponized more brutally than any deception. A man could be destroyed by revealing his darkest secrets. A kingdom could fall if its hidden shames were spoken aloud. Azerach realized that if he could hear all truths, he could control all things. During the ritual murder of Aedwynn the Maker, Azerach approached from the shadows and severed the divine Lungs with ritual blades etched with unspoken names. items.title: Imhuran the Regent of Hours
items.content:
IMHURAN THE REGENT OF HOURS

The Sovereign of Time Domain: The Clockwork Sanctum & The White Dunes of Broken Time

What the Party Knows

The party traversed Imhuran's domain - the White Dunes of Broken Time and the Clockwork Sanctum - a mechanical realm where time itself becomes visible architecture. Temporal distortions create "temporal debris" and broken timelines throughout his territory.

The Leonin Erasure

Mira revealed that Fursen is "Imhuran's Blind Spot." The Regent of Hours attempted to erase the entire Leonin people from existence - not just killing them, but removing them from the temporal record itself.

Fursen received 10,000 Leonin names from Aedwynn's fragment - the names, stories, and acts of defiance of those who resisted Imhuran's erasure. These people existed, fought back, and were hidden from Imhuran's perfect temporal record.

The Ledger of Moments

Fursen acquired "The Ledger of Moments" - a self-updating record that documents Leonin trapped in temporal stasis, evidence of their hidden resistance to the Regent's attempt to erase them from existence.
items.raw: Imhuran the Regent of Hours Overview Imhuran the Regent of Hours wields absolute control over time within 10 miles. Before the Usurpation, he was a legendary magistrate who believed perfect justice required mastery over time itself. During the murder of Aedwynn, he claimed the Heart of Time and became the arbiter of temporal fate. He maintains the Ledger of Existence containing every mortal's destined death-moment. Fursen's escape from the Trial created a crack in causality that may have larger consequences Mythic Trait: The 13-Hour Trial When Imhuran is reduced to 0 hit points, he does not die. Instead, his form fractures into thirteen temporal shards that scatter across the timeline. Simultaneously, all creatures within 500 feet are violently pulled into a pocket dimension outside normal time - the infamous The 13-Hour Trial. This is a realm of brass and crystal where time is architecture, each "hour" a separate chamber with its own challenge. The trials test combat prowess, wisdom, self-sacrifice, truthfulness, endurance, wit, mercy, justice, and more. Failure at any trial results in temporal imprisonment - the creature is frozen as a statue in the chamber, potentially forever. Success means escape after completing all thirteen chambers - but upon returning to reality, the party discovers that Imhuran has reformed in his Clockwork Sanctum at full hit points exactly 13 hours after his "defeat." The only way to permanently destroy Imhuran is to complete all thirteen trials perfectly without a single failure, then venture to the heart of the Clockwork Sanctum to destroy his actual Heart of Time (the divine organ itself). The Heart has AC 30, 800 hit points, immunity to all damage except radiant and force, and regenerates 100 hit points per round unless damaged by a weapon blessed by another Sovereign or a deity-level being. Even then, destroying it requires landing the killing blow within a 6-second window that occurs only once per hour. Lore & Background Before the

items.title: Mareatha the Vein-Mother
items.content:
MAREATHA THE VEIN-MOTHER

The Sovereign of Blood and Devotion Domain: Veinspire Cathedral & The Arterial Tunnels

What the Party Knows

The Church of the Merciful Vein

The party encountered Mareatha's followers throughout the early campaign. The Church worships her as a divine figure of mercy and healing - but the truth is far darker.

The Arterial Texts

Mira discovered the "Arterial Texts" - documents containing Mareatha's "foul crimes and deeds" that the Church hierarchy had hidden from followers.

Through speaking with Vorath's corpse, the party learned these texts contain "the Vein-Mother's mortal writings. Her doubts. Her failures. Her words before divinity."

Mareatha was once mortal and ascended to divinity.

The Arterial Tunnels

The party traversed the Arterial Tunnels - living passages with pulsing flesh and the copper taste of divine blood. These tunnels are part of Mareatha's literal body or domain.

They also explored the Veinspire Catacomb - a sacred space containing skeletal reliefs depicting templars and grim religious iconography.

The Sanguine Siphon

The party encountered the "Sanguine Siphon" - a device specifically designed to drain borrowed Mareathan power from heretics. The Church uses technologically-enhanced methods to enforce religious control and suppress heresy.

The blood flows toward the deepest chamber of her cathedral, where her true Heart Below waits - the actual Circulatory Engine she claimed from Aedwynn the Maker, a massive organ the size of a house that beats eternally in a chamber of living flesh. Mareatha reforms around this Heart over the next 2d10 days, emerging at full hit points. The only way to permanently kill Mareatha is to destroy the Heart Below. It is located in the lowest chamber of Veinspire Cathedral, accessible only through arterial tunnels filled with immune system constructs. The Heart itself has AC 28, 1,000 hit points, immunity to poison and necrotic damage, resistance to all other damage except radiant and force, and regenerates 150 hit points per round unless damaged by weapons blessed with fire or carried by someone who has completely rejected Mareatha's influence. She studied the philosophical texts of her era and became convinced that the true source of all mortal suffering was not physical disease but spiritual impurity. TALARIS BLOOMREND THE VERDANT KING

The Sovereign of Decay and Rebirth Domain: The Blooming Rot

What the Party Knows

The Law of Honesty

Upon entering the Blooming Rot, an Elder at Sporehaven warned the party:

"Always be honest. The King is always watching."

This is Talaris's fundamental law: honesty is mandatory in his domain.

The party learned this the hard way - they were banned from the local inn for lying to an innkeeper. The Verdant King enforces his law through his subjects and actively punishes dishonesty.

Territorial Nature

Route planning specifically mentioned avoiding "near the Blooming Rot" because it belongs to the Verdant King - indicating he is territorial. Elias's remains were hidden in a cave "away from any Sovereign's reach," suggesting Talaris's domain extends throughout the Verdant Pass.

What the Party Knows

Savaros Was His Pawn

After Savaros the Skin-Walker died, Sol witnessed eyes forming in the black ooze and received a telepathic threat:

"You will pay for what you did to my pawn."

Savaros represented 15 centuries of Ultharion's work and planning - now destroyed by the party.

The Threat

Ultharion now knows the party's faces. He has declared them enemies and is actively seeking revenge for the loss of his pawn.

The Obsidian Shepherd is watching.

items.content:
VOR'KAEL THE HOLLOW EMPRESS

The Sovereign of Hunger and Consumption Domain: The Devoured Courts

What the Party Knows

Mira's Revelation

Mira explained Vor'Kael's nature: She claimed the Maker's stomach - the organ of digestion. She breaks down, processes, and incorporates concepts and ideas into herself.

When concepts are incompatible or contradictory, she doesn't destroy them - she expels them.

Kael's True Nature

Kael is a "vomited fragment" - a piece of concept Vor'Kael tried to consume and couldn't stomach. This explains Kael's insatiable hunger for knowledge. Vor'Kael will spend eternity trying to finish what she started - attempting to fully digest Kael.

This indigestible nature directly caused the death of Savaros the Skin-Walker. When Savaros tried to consume and reshape Kael, Kael's fundamental incompatibility destroyed him from within.

The Tome of Vor'Kael

Sol attempted to read the "Tome of Vor'Kael" but discovered the book was sentient - it began reading HIM instead, describing what made him "delicious" to consume. Vor'Kael's hunger extends beyond concepts to other beings.

Garrett the Smith

Overview

The Discreet Craftsman Profession: Smith Location: The Whetstone and Anvil, Lesser Sacral District, Veinspire Role: Contact, Equipment Source, Information

Garrett is a trustworthy smith with four generations of metalwork in his family. He doesn't ask questions and doesn't talk to the Church.

Appearance

A smith in his fifties with thick arms and burn scars. Hands that have shaped steel for decades.

The Whetstone and Anvil: His shop in the Lesser Sacral District. Well-maintained forge, quality work on display.

Personality

  • Professional and discreet
  • Helpful to those Seraphine trusts
  • Doesn't involve himself in Church politics
  • Curious about unusual materials and legends
  • Fair in his dealings

Background

Thirty-two years of smithing experience. Four generations of metalwork in his family. Twenty years ago, he found pre-Sovereign gear on a corpse in the Underways â€” an experience that opened his eyes to what exists beneath the surface.

Relationships

Seraphine Vale

Seraphine directed the party to Garrett:

"The Whetstone and Anvil. Three blocks east. Garrett's place â€” he doesn't ask questions and he doesn't talk to the Church."

Garrett already knew they were coming:

"She came by this morning. Told me if anyone showed up asking for shelter, I should give it. Said she might be about to do something stupid."

What They Know

Services

Smithing

items.title: Mira Alethain
items.content:
Mira Alethain

Overview

Mira was a two-thousand-year-old Sanctified Champion who witnessed the Usurpation itself. She served Mareatha for millennia before discovering the Sanguine Doctrine was a lie. As the last of the Seven Heretics, she was hunted for thirty years before being consumed by Savaros the High Keeper in the Catacomb Reliquary.

Appearance

Physical Appearance A weathered woman in her apparent fifties, though her true age stretched back before the Sovereigns' ascension â€” she witnessed the Usurpation itself. Grey-streaked dark hair pulled back severely. Sharp, assessing eyes that had seen too much death. Hands that healed but remembered how to kill. She moved with a healer's gentleness and a warrior's readiness â€” never quite one or the other.

A faded scar ran along her left forearm â€” a reminder of when she cut the Mareathan brand from her own flesh.

She always wore her wedding ring.

Personality

Core Traits:
  • Pragmatic survivor â€” two thousand years taught harsh lessons
  • Fierce protector â€” would die for those she considered hers
  • Unshakeable conviction â€” her faith in truth could not be broken
  • Controlled fury â€” millennia of grief compressed into cold purpose
  • Widow â€” she lost her husband to what she thought was bad luck; she learned it was murder
What She Wanted:
  1. Kill Kaleth Vorn â€” the Tribunal Hand who hunted the Seven âœ“ COMPLETE
  2. Reunite with Elias â€” lay her bones beside her husband's âœ“ COMPLETE (by the party)
  3. Protect the Arterial Texts â€” the truth must survive (location now lost)
  4. See the party survive â€” they reminded her why she kept fighting
What She Feared:
  • That she'd led four young people to their deaths (like the other six)
  • That the Texts would be destroyed and the truth would die with her
  • That she'd become the monster the Church already thought she was

Background

Before the Sovereigns

Mira was alive before the Usurpation â€” before the Thirteen murdered Aedwynn and claimed divine power. She witnessed the old world, walked under true divine light, and watched thirteen mortals butcher a god and reshape reality around their stolen organs.

When the Sovereigns ascended, Mira chose to serve Mareatha â€” believing the new order was necessary, or at least unavoidable. For over two millennia, she devoted herself to the Vein-Mother's church, rising to become one of its most skilled and respected healers. At a certain point of power and conviction, her aging simply... stopped. She willed herself to continue, and her body obeyed.

Her oath was simple: Truth. Justice. Protection of the Faithful.

The Discovery

Thirty years ago, Mira and six other priests discovered something that shattered her faith:

The Sanguine Doctrine was a lie.

Deep in the Arterial Archives, they found the Arterial Texts â€” Mareatha's own writings from before the Usurpation. Her mortal words. Her doubts. Her failures. Her uncertainty about whether killing Aedwynn was right.

The Texts proved:

  • Mareatha was fallible before divinity
  • The Sanguine Doctrine was written by mortals AFTER the Usurpation
  • The Church's foundation was political consolidation, not divine mandate
  • The Vein-Mother herself had questioned the murder of the Maker

The Seven Heretics

The seven priests who discovered this truth:

Name Role Fate
Aldric Sarne Theologian â˜ ï¸ Killed, Year 3
Elias Alethain Healer â€” Mira's husband â˜ ï¸ Killed, Year 8
Corwin Marsh Scholar â˜ ï¸ Killed, Year 12
Daven Holt Chronicler â˜ ï¸ Killed, Year 17
Bram Ashford Warrior-Priest â˜ ï¸ Killed, Year 21
Adelaide Dunne Seer â˜ ï¸ Killed, Year 26

They tried to reform the Church from within. They were branded heretics and hunted. They fled Veinspire and scattered. For thirty years, Mira believed they had simply disappeared â€” bad luck, dangerous roads. She didn't know the Tribunal had systematically murdered every single one of them.

Elias

Mira married Elias Alethain during their flight from Veinspire â€” finding love in the midst of being hunted. Despite her ancient age, she had never truly loved before him. She took his name.

In Year 8, Elias traveled near Verdant Pass. He never came back. Word reached Mira that he'd died in the mountain passes â€” a travel accident, they said. His body was never found.

The truth: Savaros the High Keeper found Elias and pushed him from a cliff. Elias crawled to a cave and eventually died there, alone. Talaris, impressed by his tenacity, refused to claim him â€” letting him die on his own terms in the Cave of Waiting.

For twenty-two years, Mira believed it was an accident. Then the Maker revealed the truth.

Thirty Years of Hiding

For three decades, Mira lived as "Mira Hemm" â€” a healer in Pallid Crossroads. She delivered children, buried parents, taught medicine to the next generation, and watched her friends disappear one by one (not knowing they were murdered).

She knew they would find her eventually. She just hoped to outlast them out of spite first.

Relationships

With the Party

Character Relationship
Sol Raven Recognized something ancient in him. "You're connected to something older than the Sovereigns. Be careful what that means."
Jonas Respected his directness, frustrated by his recklessness. "Defiance without wisdom gets people killed."
Fursen Gentle with him â€” recognized someone still adapting to freedom after imprisonment.
Kael Studied him longest. Knew what he was. Told him the truth even though it hurt.

With Antagonists

Character Relationship
Kaleth Vorn Primary target. She ended him. âœ“
Seraphine Vale The child she delivered thirty-four years ago. "She's dangerous to you. Not to me."
Savaros The monster who killed her husband â€” and eventually killed her.

Seraphine Vale

Thirty-four years ago, Mira â€” still a devoted servant of Mareatha â€” delivered Seraphine Vale into the world. She blessed that child in Mareatha's name. Now that child hunts her as a heretic.

When Mira looked at Seraphine, she saw a victim of the same lies she once believed, a child raised without the chance to question. She didn't want to kill her â€” she wanted to save her.

What They Know

Ancient History:
  • Witnessed the Usurpation â€” watched the Thirteen murder Aedwynn
  • Knew the Sovereigns when they were mortal
  • Remembered the world before the Sovereigns reshaped it
About the Church:
  • The Sanguine Doctrine is fabricated
  • The Arterial Texts prove Mareatha's doubts
  • The Tribunal systematically murdered the Seven Heretics
About the Present:
  • Kaleth Vorn was a cynical murderer who found faith useful
  • Savaros was a Skin-Walker infiltrating the Church
  • The Cardinal is also a Skin-Walker, planted even earlier

Key Moments

First Encounter with the Party

The party first met Mira under her alias Mira Hemm at her clinic in the Pallid Crossroads. Jonas arrived bearing Imhuran's temporal brand on his chest â€” clock-hands still ticking, counting toward death.

Mira examined him, listened to his story about the 13-Hour Trial, about trying to intimidate a Sovereign. Then she called him what he was:

"You're an idiot. An arrogant, reckless idiot who's lucky to still have a heartbeat. But you're a lucky idiot, and that's something."

She lifted the curse. The mark stayed, but it wouldn't kill him anymore.

Undying Conviction â€” Killing Kaleth Vorn

When Kaleth Vorn's Sanguine Siphon drained Mira's crimson aura, he thought he'd won. What he didn't know: the red aura was borrowed power. Mira's true power â€” her Undying Conviction â€” was entirely her own.

She rose wreathed in orange-gold fire, speaking the names of her dead friends:

"Aldric. Elias. Corwin. Daven. Bram. Adelaide. I am still here."

Four strikes:
  1. Shoulder through to below the arm â€” split him open
  2. Backswing â€” removed his other arm at the elbow
  3. Rising cut â€” sternum to throat
  4. Executioner's stroke â€” head removed
Time elapsed: Less than four seconds.

Death in the Catacomb Reliquary

In the Catacomb Reliquary beneath Veinspire, Mira faced Savaros â€” the ancient Skin-Walker. Despite her power, three levels of exhaustion from triggering Undying Conviction left her vulnerable.

Her flesh was ripped from her bones.

Savaros consumed her flesh, adding her to his collection of stolen identities. Her skeleton collapsed to the cold stone floor. Her wedding ring remained in the gore. Sol Raven retrieved it.

Two thousand years of conviction. Thirty years of hiding. Six friends murdered. A husband she never got to bury. It ended on cold stone in a monster's lair.

Final Rest

Reunited at Last Location: The Cave of Waiting, Verdant Pass Completed by: Jonas, Sol Raven, Fursen

The party carried Mira's remains through the Blooming Rot. In the Cave of Waiting, they found Elias Alethain â€” his skeleton pristine after twenty-two years in the one place Talaris cannot reach.

Fursen laid Mira's bones beside her husband. Sol placed her wedding ring on her finger and moved her hand until her fingers rested against Elias's.

ðŸ¦ "I am sorry we could not reunite you in life. But at least in death, we have brought you together."

â€” Fursen

Two skeletons now rest in the Cave of Waiting, holding hands in a place where nothing rots.

The Two Auras

Mareathan Power vs True Conviction

Mira carried two sources of power, visible as two distinct auras.

The Red Aura (Mareathan Divine Power)

Despite breaking her oath to the Church, Mira retained divine power from her two millennia of service to Mareatha. This manifested as a crimson aura. Near Mareathan holy sites, she blazed with crimson light visible to mundane sight. Could be drained by Tribunal artifacts like the Sanguine Siphon.

The Orange Aura (Undying Conviction)

Mira's true power â€” her Undying Conviction â€” had nothing to do with Mareatha or any Sovereign. It was entirely hers, forged from two thousand years of refusing to break, thirty years of grief compressed into purpose, six names burned into her soul, and love that outlasted death and betrayal.

This manifested as an orange-gold glow â€” warm like sunrise, terrible like wildfire. Could not be drained, suppressed, or stolen by any divine artifact.

Legacy

"Aldric. Elias. Corwin. Daven. Bram. Adelaide."

Now add one more name to the litany:

Mira.

The Seven Heretics are all dead.

The party carries her bones, her ring. They remember.

She died fighting beside people she'd known for less than a week, in a hole beneath a church that had hunted her for thirty years, trying to stop a conspiracy she'd only begun to understand.

She died as she lived: refusing to run.

The Bleeding Blade remembers her. It felt her die.

Quotes

"Aldric. Elias. Corwin. Daven. Bram. Adelaide. I am still here."

"I broke my oath to an institution. I never broke my oath to what mattered."

"Down here, pride is a luxury. Precision keeps you alive."

"Twenty-two years. I thought Elias died to a mountain road. Twenty-two years."

"I watched them kill the Maker. I watched them build their churches on his corpse. I served them for two thousand years. And they lied about all of it."

Undying Conviction

items.title: The Cardinal
items.content:
The Cardinal

Overview

The Cardinal is the mysterious power behind the Tribunal of the Sanguine Doctrine. No one knows their true identity or nature â€” only that their authority is absolute.

Appearance

Unknown. The Cardinal operates through intermediaries and written orders. Their physical form â€” if they have one â€” has never been reliably described.

Personality

According to Thessaly:

"The Cardinal isn't like Kaleth. Kaleth was a blade â€” pointed, direct, predictable. The Cardinal is a web. You won't see the threads until you're already tangled."

Background

What Is Known

From Seraphine Vale:

"I don't know who the Cardinal is. No one does. Not even Savaros, I think."

"The Cardinal isn't a person â€” it's a position. A title. Someone who speaks for... something higher."

Authority:

"Every major decision goes through the Cardinal. Every purge. Every doctrinal revision. Every execution order for high-value targets."

"The order to hunt the Seven Heretics. That came from the Cardinal. Thirty years ago."

Nature:

"I've heard rumors that the Cardinal isn't human. That they haven't been human for a very long time. But rumors are cheap in Veinspire."

Theories

What the Cardinal might be:

  1. An ancient human â€” preserved through divine means
  2. A Sovereign fragment â€” a piece of Mareatha's consciousness
  3. Something older â€” predating even the Usurpation
  4. A position, not a being â€” occupied by different entities over time
  5. The true voice of Mareatha â€” speaking through a vessel

What They Know

The Cardinal has access to:

  • All Tribunal intelligence and operations
  • Doctrinal authority over Church teachings
  • Communication channels with unknown entities
  • Historical records the Church has supposedly destroyed

Key Moments

The Seven Heretics

The Cardinal ordered the hunt for the Seven thirty years ago:

  • Targeted Mira Alethain and her companions
  • Assigned Kaleth Vorn as the weapon
  • Six of seven successfully killed over thirty years
  • Mira was the last survivor

The Confluence

The Cardinal orchestrated the Confluence â€” a resurrection ritual that brought back Ardian Bloodveil, the legendary First Templar.

A letter from the Cardinal was found in Ardian's quarters, requesting a private meeting.

Doctrinal Control

Every major doctrinal revision passes through the Cardinal. They shape what the Church believes â€” deciding which truths become heresy and which lies become doctrine.

items.title: Thessaly
items.content:
Thessaly

Overview

The Keeper of Forbidden Knowledge Profession: Bookseller (Official), Dealer in Forbidden Texts (Actual) Location: The Frayed Codex, Lesser Sacral District, Veinspire Role: Information Source, Rare Text Dealer

Thessaly runs The Frayed Codex, a narrow bookshop that deals in far more than hymnals and devotional texts. She is one of the most knowledgeable beings in Veinspire about forbidden history.

Appearance

Old. Impossibly old. Skin like crumpled parchment, hair like white cobwebs, fingers like bundled twigs. Wears spectacles with lenses so thick they magnify her eyes to unsettling proportions.

Despite her frail appearance, she moves through her maze of books with the certainty of someone who knows exactly where everything is.

The Frayed Codex: A narrow shopfront between a chandler and a boarded-up residence. Sign barely legible â€” faded paint depicting an open book with curling pages. Inside: larger than it looks. Every surface covered in books, scrolls, and papers. Stacks reaching to the ceiling. The door bell has no clapper â€” removed intentionally. Smells of old paper, older ink, and dried lavender hanging from the rafters.

Personality

  • Patient with seekers of knowledge
  • Irreverent toward age and status (calls 2000-year-old Mira "girl")
  • Values truth over comfort
  • Protects dangerous knowledge rather than destroying it
  • Has grown weary of immortality â€” letting herself age now

Background

Thessaly is over 2000 years old. For centuries she used de-aging effects available to high-level characters in this world. She has now deactivated this â€” she's decided enough is enough and is letting herself age naturally.

She has spent her impossibly long life collecting forbidden knowledge. Pre-Usurpation fragments, restricted texts, documents the Church tried to destroy. Her obsession is the truth that has been erased.

Relationships

Mira Alethain

Thessaly knew Mira before she fled Veinspire thirty years ago. She recognized her immediately:

"You look tired. And you've lost something. The red light you used to carry. Finally stopped pretending to be one of them?"

Fursen

She gave Fursen the Ledger of Moments for free â€” proof that a living Leonin existed was worth more than gold.

"I've spent my whole life collecting forbidden knowledge. The truth of the Leonin extinction is the one thing I've never been able to find."

What They Know

About the Resonant Codex

"That book is a Resonant Codex. There are perhaps four in existence. They don't get 'found' â€” they choose."

"It's quiet now. Content. I've never seen one content before."

About the Cardinal

"The Cardinal isn't like Kaleth. Kaleth was a blade â€” pointed, direct, predictable. The Cardinal is a web. You won't see the threads until you're already tangled."

About Ardian's Items

"That's not a Skin-Walker's kit. That's a vessel's."

"The Confluence wasn't a resurrection. It was an insertion. They didn't bring Ardian Bloodveil back. They built a shell and put something else inside."

About Azerach Pacts

"He doesn't want blood. Doesn't want souls. He wants secrets. Yours. Others'. The things people bury so deep they forget they buried them."

"Warlocks of the Whispered King... they start to fade. People forget they're in the room. Conversations move past them. They become... background."

Services

Books Available

The Doctrine of Still Air (75 gp) â€” Purchased by Sol
  • Azerach's philosophy of silence
  • The nature of his brand (a door that opens both ways)
  • The Litany of Unmaking (forces truth for 1 hour, costs speaker's voice for 1 day)
The Unfinished Meal (100 gp) â€” Not Purchased
  • Meditation on being consumed by Vor'Kael
  • Pages blank until looked at, words dissolving when you try to read them
  • Shows what the Empress would find delicious about YOU
The Ledger of Moments (FREE) â€” Given to Fursen
  • Partial transcription of Imhuran's temporal records
  • Contains Leonin history â€” including Fursen's mother Vaelith
  • Updates itself â€” new names appear, old names vanish

Key Moments

First Visit

The party visited Thessaly at the Frayed Codex in Veinspire. Mira recognized the shop. Thessaly recognized Mira.

She sold Sol the Doctrine of Still Air, gave Fursen the Ledger of Moments, and warned them about the Cardinal.

Second Visit â€” Deaths Reported

The party informed Thessaly that Mira and Kael were killed by Savaros (Skin-Walker) in the Catacomb Reliquary.

Thessaly's reaction:

"Two thousand years. Two thousand years she survived. And a Skin-Walker..."

"How many Leonin are even left in the world?... You. Walking around Veinspire. Not exactly inconspicuous."

items.title: Vorath
items.content:
Vorath

Overview

Vorath was a Tribunal assassin who hunted the Seven Heretics for thirty years. He was the final clue that revealed the truth of Elias's death and Kaleth's systematic murder of Mira's friends.

Appearance

  • Build: Thin
  • Hair: Grey-streaked
  • Distinguishing feature: Limp in left leg
  • Face: Forgettable â€” designed to blend in
  • Cover Identity: Trader passing through Dusthollow

Background

Vorath served as an assassin for the Tribunal, operating under the direction of Kaleth Vorn. His mission was to capture Mira Alethain alive and transport her to Veinspire for interrogation about the Arterial Texts.

The List

Vorath carried a list of seven namesâ€”six crossed out, one remaining:

  1. ~~Aldric Sarne~~ â€” Theologian
  2. ~~Elias Alethain~~ â€” Healer
  3. ~~Corwin Marsh~~ â€” Scholar
  4. ~~Daven Holt~~ â€” Chronicler
  5. ~~Bram Ashford~~ â€” Warrior-Priest
  6. ~~Adelaide Dunne~~ â€” Seer
  7. Mira Alethain â€” Pallid Crossroads

Key Moments

The Hunt

Mission:
  • Target: Mira Alethain (last of seven heretic priests)
  • Objective: Capture alive, transport to Veinspire
  • Purpose: Extract knowledge about the Arterial Texts
  • Overseer: High Inquisitor Seraphine Vale
Timeline in Dusthollow:
  • Day 1: Arrived, began observation
  • Day 4: Visited Crossroads as trader
  • Day 12: Used "Alethain" name as a test; Mira paused at "Sanguine Doctrine"
  • Day 15: Sent confirmation to Kaleth Vorn
  • Day 21: Party discovered his room, took all evidence
  • Day 22: Killed by Mira Alethain

Death & Interrogation

Vorath was caught preparing to flee at dawn. Jonas threw his hammer (missed, hit the horse instead), throwing Vorath from the saddle. He surrendered and offered information in exchange for his lifeâ€”specifically demanding death as the price.

Mira killed him without hesitation.

Five Questions (Speak with Dead):
  1. Who is K? â€” "Kaleth Vorn. Tribunal Hand. Veinspire Catacomb. Seraphine's blade in shadow."
  1. Purpose of interrogating Mira about the Arterial Texts? â€” "The Texts contain the Vein-Mother's mortal writings. Her doubts. Her failures. The Tribunal must destroy them before they spread."
  1. Is Seraphine Vale still hunting the party? â€” "Four heretics. Fire mage. Branded warrior. Leonin escapee. The anomaly. Vale's secondary priority."
  1. State of Veinspire? â€” "Theorists scattered. Three cells discovered. Executions public. Leader Carveth fled or dead."
  1. High Inquisitor's current location? â€” "The Crimson Sanctum. Cathedral's upper spire."

The Revelation

When Mira saw the list of crossed-out names, she recognized them all:

  • Aldric Sarne â€” She thought his heart gave out. It was poison.
  • Elias Alethain â€” Her husband. She thought he died in the mountain passes. It was murder.
  • Corwin Marsh â€” She thought he'd found somewhere safe. He was killed in his sleep.
  • Daven Holt â€” They said he drowned himself. It was staged.
  • Bram Ashford â€” He just vanished. Ambushed.
  • Adelaide Dunne â€” Her letters stopped. Interrogated and executed.

For thirty years, Mira believed her friends had simply scattered and died to time and bad luck.

Vorath's letters revealed the truth: Kaleth Vorn murdered every single one of them.

This is why Mira is done running.

items.title: Broma
items.content:
Broma

Overview

The Passion-Fire Smith Profession: Master Blacksmith Location: Broma's Forge, Forge Ward, Crownfall Race: Dwarf Status: Active

Broma is a master blacksmith who fled the Bastion of Fireblood when Kaedris began demanding oaths from all smiths. She brought her passion-fire forging technique with her to Crownfall.

Appearance

  • Age: Middle-aged by dwarven standards
  • Build: Short, broad, arms like tree trunks wrapped in burn scars
  • Hair: Grey, pulled back in a practical knot
  • Face: Map of old burns â€” ridged scars pulling at features, one eye clouded white
  • Hands: Calloused, burn-scarred, steady
The Forge: Located in the Forge Ward. Sign of the cracked anvil ("she thinks it's funny"). Flames burn wrong â€” shifting colors from orange to red to something almost purple. She uses passion-fire â€” burns hotter than physics allows.

Personality

  • Professional: Gruff, efficient, doesn't waste words
  • Knowledgeable: Recognizes pre-Usurpation alloys, understands cursed weapons
  • Cautious: Knows her limits, knows what she won't touch
  • Practical: Will tell you honestly if something can or can't be done

Background

Broma worked the heart-forges in the Bastion of Fireblood before she fled Kaedris's domain. She knows how to shape metal that doesn't want to be shaped, how to listen to a blade.

She fled when Kaedris began demanding oaths from all smiths. She brought her technique â€” passion-fire forging â€” with her to Crownfall.

What They Know

About Pre-Usurpation Metal:
  • Recognizes it on sight
  • Knows how to work it (maybe)
  • Understands its properties
About Cursed Weapons:
  • Most curses are bad enchantments â€” can be unraveled
  • The Bleeding Blade is different â€” the curse IS the weapon
  • Breaking that curse would leave dead metal
  • Doesn't know anyone in Crownfall who could break it
About the Pulsehammer:
  • Whatever it is, it terrifies her
  • It's not a curse â€” it's a "mistake," a "wound in the shape of a weapon"
  • Even someone who worked in the Bastion won't touch it

Services

Smithing

  • Pre-Usurpation metal work (with passion-fire)
  • Assessment of unusual materials
  • Custom work if materials allow

The Custodian Armplate

Jonas brought her a pre-Usurpation alloy armplate. Her Assessment:
  • Pre-Usurpation alloy, maybe older â€” the Maker's work, or close to it
  • The metal "doesn't remember how to be shaped anymore"
  • Normal forges can't touch it
  • Her passion-fire might work â€” "the metal will fight me every step"
Properties She Identified:
  • Metal remembers impacts, adapts, learns
  • Magically inert â€” spells slide off, enchantments don't stick
  • Doesn't rust, tarnish, or age
Commission:
Item Client Cost Deposit Status
Custodian Shield Jonas 200gp 100gp paid In progress

Timeline: 2 weeks to 2 months â€” the metal decides. Will send word to the Velvet Thorn when ready.

Key Moments

The Pulsehammer Incident

When Jonas showed her the pulsehammer, Broma's reaction was terror.

She went white, staggered back, knocked over tools. The forge-flames guttered like they were trying to hide.

"GET THAT OUT."

"Do you have any idea what you're carrying? DO YOU?"

"That thing isn't cursed. Cursed implies someone DID something to it. That â€” that's a mistake. A wound in the shape of a weapon. It shouldn't EXIST."

She demanded Jonas get it out of her shop, the district, and Crownfall entirely.

Quotes

"No normal forge will touch this. The metal doesn't remember how to be shaped anymore. It's forgotten what heat means." "I can work it. Maybe. My flames aren't normal â€” I brought the technique from the Bastion. Passion-fire. Burns hotter than physics allows." "Whatever you're doing with that... other thing. Whatever plan you have. Make sure it's worth dying for. Because carrying something like that? Death is the BEST outcome."

items.title: Edra
items.content:
Edra

Role: Healer | Status: Active | Location: Hall of Mending, Crownfall

Who She Is

Edra is a middle-aged healer at the Hall of Mending in Crownfall's Southring. Practical clothing. Grey-streaked hair tied back. Calloused hands stained greenish from herbal work.

She's seen all kinds come through the Hall's doors. A robed skeleton didn't faze her.

The Hall of Mending

The Hall of Mending is the closest thing Crownfall has to charitable healing. No icons. No altars. No Sovereign symbols. Just healers fixing what's broken.

They deal in bodies â€” broken bones, infections, minor curses. Soul problems are beyond their scope.

Interaction with Sol

Sol came seeking a cure for his Possibility infection. Edra recognized it was beyond physical healing.

"That sounds like something touched your soul. Or your mind. Greater Restoration might help â€” but no one here can cast it. That's temple magic."

She directed Sol to Sister Varen in the Threshold.

items.title: Marek
items.content:
Marek

Role: Gem Appraiser | Status: Active | Location: The Exchange, Crownfall

Who He Is

Marek is a dwarf gem dealer operating a stall in The Exchange. He has a grey beard that reaches his belt and wears a jeweler's loupe on a chain around his neck.

He doesn't smile. Doesn't frown. Just assesses with the flat eyes of someone who's been cheated before and learned to spot it coming.

Business Style

"Eight hundred sixty gold for everything. That's a fair price â€” not generous, not a cheat."

Marek doesn't haggle. Doesn't play games. He gives fair prices and expects fair dealing in return. His voice is like gravel in a bucket.

Interaction with the Party

Sol and Jonas sold their gems to Marek â€” four rubies and three sapphires. He appraised them methodically, unhurried, and paid 860 gold without argument.

"Count it if you like. I don't short people."

items.title: Senna
items.content:
Senna

Role: Grey Market Apothecary | Status: Active | Location: The Spillway, Crownfall

Who She Is

Senna operates an unmarked apothecary in the Spillway â€” House Keth territory. Grey-streaked hair pulled back tight. Eyes the color of old copper. She deals in specialized remedies that won't be found in legitimate shops.

Mood suppressants. Emotional dampeners. Things for people who need discretion.

Her Wares

Senna showed Fursen three options for calming a companion's temper:

  • Stillwater Draught â€” Slows the blood, dulls the edge. 4 hours. 5 gold.
  • Ashveil â€” Chew or brew. Gentler effect. Most of a day. 3 gold/week.
  • Moonbind Salve â€” Rub on skin. Target won't know. Full day. 10 gold.

The Deal

Fursen bought the Moonbind Salve â€” the one that could be applied without the target's knowledge.

"The real risk isn't physical. It's trust. If he finds out you've been dosing him without his knowledge..."

She shrugged. "That's not my business. I sell remedies. What you do with them is between you and whatever you pray to."

Thresh's referral settled his debt with her. Next time, full price.

items.title: Seraphine Vale
items.content:
Seraphine Vale

Overview

Seraphine Vale was the youngest High Inquisitor in three centuries â€” a true believer who had never experienced doubt. Thirty-four years ago, Mira Alethain delivered her into the world. Now, after learning that Kaleth Vorn called her "the ideal instrument" and that her faith was built on lies, she carries Mira's legendary sword and flees toward an uncertain future.

Appearance

Physical Appearance A striking woman in her mid-thirties with sharp features and eyes the color of dried blood â€” a mark of Mareatha's favor. Her dark hair is worn in a severe braid, and she carries herself with the absolute certainty of someone who has never questioned their purpose. Her Inquisitor's vestments are immaculate white trimmed with arterial red, and she wears the holy symbol of Mareatha openly at her throat.

There is no cruelty in her face. That's what makes her dangerous. She genuinely believes she is saving souls.

Mira Alethain remembers when those blood-colored eyes were just a child's brown. Before the Church got to her.

Personality

Core Traits (Before Shattering):
  • True believer â€” had never experienced genuine doubt
  • Righteous certainty â€” knew she was doing holy work
  • Patient predator â€” preferred to study prey before striking
  • Silver-tongued â€” turned interrogations into theological debates
  • Incorruptible â€” could not be bribed, seduced, or swayed
After Faith Shattered:
  • Uncertain â€” everything she believed was a lie
  • Betrayed â€” fourteen years of service, and she was just "an instrument"
  • Seeking â€” needs new meaning, new purpose
  • Armed â€” carries Oathkeeper, a blade forged to cut through lies

Background

The Vale Family

The Vale family has served the Mareathan Church for six generations. Faithful. Devout. Unquestioning. Seraphine's mother died in service to the Vein-Mother when Seraphine was seven.

And Mira Alethain delivered Seraphine into the world.

Thirty-four years ago, before Mira fled Veinspire, before she became "Mira Hemm" â€” she was one of the Church's most skilled healers. She attended Seraphine's mother through a difficult birth. She blessed the child in Mareatha's name.

Now that infant hunts her as a heretic.

The Perfect Servant

Seraphine was raised in the Church after her mother's death. The clergy became her family. The Sanguine Doctrine became her truth. She never had a chance to question â€” the faith was woven into her bones before she could walk.

At thirty-four, she became the youngest High Inquisitor in three centuries. The Church celebrated her as proof that faith conquers all.

Mira saw her as proof that the Church devours its children.

What She Discovered

When Mira and Sol confronted her at the Church of the Merciful Vein:

  • Mira revealed she killed Kaleth Vorn
  • Mira revealed she delivered Seraphine thirty-four years ago
  • Sol told her she'd been indoctrinated her entire life

They showed her Kaleth's journal and letters:

  • Kill list with six crossed-out names
  • Journal entry calling Seraphine "the ideal instrument"
  • Kaleth's admission he didn't believe any of the doctrine
  • Evidence of his murders spanning thirty years

Her response to learning Kaleth was dead: "Good."

Relationships

With Mira Alethain

What Seraphine Knew What Seraphine Didn't Know
Mira Alethain was the last of the Seven Heretics Mira delivered her when she was born
She was once a respected healer before her fall Mira is over two thousand years old
Capturing her would be legendary Mira could kill her without effort
Mira didn't want to kill her â€” she wanted to save her

When Mira looked at Seraphine, she didn't see an enemy. She saw a victim of the same lies she once believed, a child raised without the chance to question.

With Kaleth Vorn

Seraphine believed Kaleth was a devoted servant of the Tribunal. She had no idea he was a cynical murderer who found her faith amusing.

From Kaleth's journal, he called her "the ideal instrument."

"He called me an instrument. Fourteen years of service, and that's what I was to him. A tool."

With the Party

Character Relationship
Sol Raven Gave her Oathkeeper â€” believed she needed something to hold onto
Mira Alethain The woman who delivered her and shattered her faith
Kael Buried behind her church

What They Know

About the Church:
  • Kaleth Vorn didn't believe any of the doctrine
  • Kaleth systematically murdered the Seven Heretics over thirty years
  • She was used as an "instrument" â€” never a partner
  • The Church may be built on lies
Intelligence Provided to the Party:
  • Savaros â€” High Keeper of the Catacomb Reliquary, Kaleth's superior
  • The Cardinal â€” Position above Savaros, may not be human, ordered the hunt for the Seven
  • The Confluence â€” Ritual at the new moon, days away, Kaleth feared it
  • The Martyr's Gauntlet â€” Cathedral vault is empty; may be with Savaros

Key Moments

The Confrontation

Seraphine waited at the Church of the Merciful Vein as ordered by Kaleth Vorn. When Mira and Sol approached, she was prepared to capture the legendary last member of the Seven.

Instead, Mira stepped forward and spoke the truth:

"I delivered you. Did you know that? Thirty-four years ago. Your mother was afraid â€” the birth was difficult. But you were strong. You cried so loud the priests in the next chamber heard you."

Faith Shattering

After seeing Kaleth's journal â€” his contempt for the faith she'd devoted her life to, his use of her as a tool â€” Seraphine's certainty cracked.

She dismissed the guards with a false report, kenneled the Blood-Hound, and set aside the Obedience Draught she was supposed to use on Mira.

The Confluence

Seraphine witnessed the Confluence â€” the resurrection of Ardian Bloodveil, the legendary First Templar.

She sensed something was deeply wrong.

Whether Oathkeeper warned her, or her shattered faith made her sensitive to deception â€” Seraphine recognized that the "returned hero" was not what he appeared to be.

Flight from Veinspire

After the Confluence, Seraphine:

  • Renounced her faith entirely â€” not just doubt, but complete rejection
  • Left a hidden letter in her old room at the Church of the Merciful Vein
  • Fled with Vela Thorne â€” the rescued archivist who also has no place in the Church
  • Took Oathkeeper with her
  • Heading to Crownfall â€” Unclaimed territory, outside Sovereign control

Oathkeeper

After the events in the Catacomb Reliquary, Sol Raven gave Seraphine Oathkeeper â€” Mira Alethain's legendary greatsword.

The blade that served a two-thousand-year-old saint now rests in the hands of a thirty-four-year-old woman whose faith just shattered.

Why Sol gave it to her: Sol believed Seraphine needed something to hold onto â€” something that represented conviction and purpose. Mira's blade, forged to cut through lies, seemed fitting for someone who just learned her entire life was built on them. She carries Oathkeeper now â€” a blade forged to cut through lies, given to a woman who just learned her entire life was one.

The Letter

Seraphine left a hidden letter in her old room at the Church of the Merciful Vein. Its contents include:

  • Her suspicions about Ardian Bloodveil
  • Warning that something is wrong with the "returned" First Templar
  • Her renunciation of the Mareathan faith
  • Where she might be going

The party hasn't found it yet. They were in the Throat of Forgotten Things. Their contact has vanished. Only the letter remains.

Quotes

"I don't hate heretics. I pity them. They've lost their way, and it falls to us to guide them back â€” or grant them the mercy of ending their suffering." â€” Before

"He called me an instrument. Fourteen years of service, and that's what I was to him. A tool." â€” After

"Good." â€” Her response to learning Kaleth was dead

Thirty-four years ago, Mira Alethain delivered her into the world. Now, after learning that Kaleth Vorn called her "the ideal instrument" and that her faith was built on lies, she carries Mira's legendary sword and flees toward an uncertain future. Her dark hair is worn in a severe braid, and she carries herself with the absolute certainty of someone who has never questioned their purpose. Her Inquisitor's vestments are immaculate white trimmed with arterial red, and she wears the holy symbol of Mareatha openly at her throat. There is no cruelty in her face. That's what makes her dangerous. She genuinely believes she is saving souls. Mira Alethain remembers when those blood-colored eyes were just a child's brown. Before the Church got to her. items.title: Sister Varen
items.content:
Sister Varen

Role: Ancient Shrine Keeper | Status: Active | Location: The Threshold, Crownfall

Who She Is

Sister Varen is impossibly old â€” over two thousand years. She keeps a pre-Usurpation shrine in the Threshold, Crownfall's cemetery district. Her eyes are milky but sharp. Her voice is dry like paper left too long in the sun.

She was there when Crownfall was founded â€” not three hundred years ago as the histories claim, but two thousand years ago, after the Usurpation. She helped build the barrier that blinds divine sight.

The Old Ways

Sister Varen practices pre-Usurpation faith â€” the religion that existed before the Thirteen murdered Aedwynn. She can perform Greater Restoration and other powerful rituals, but she doesn't trade for gold.

She trades for memories. Specifically, memories of the world before the Murder.

The Trade with Sol

Sol came to her seeking a cure for his Possibility infection â€” the whispers of unlived lives bleeding into his consciousness. In exchange for Greater Restoration, Sister Varen asked for a memory of the world before.

Sol shared a vision: golden wheat fields under blue skies, children laughing, a world without ash or corruption.

"I had forgotten what blue looked like," Sister Varen whispered, tears in her milky eyes.

She performed the rite. The voices were silenced â€” pushed behind the Door of Possibility, muffled but not destroyed.

What She Knows

  • Crownfall's true founding â€” 2000 years ago, by refugees fleeing the Usurpation
  • The barrier that protects Crownfall from divine sight
  • The combined strength of the Ten Houses â€” enough to rival a Sovereign
  • Memories of Aedwynn and the world She created

items.title: The Dealer (Green Door)
items.content:
The Dealer (Green Door)

Location: The Green Door, Kennels District, Crownfall | Role: Magic item dealer

Overview

The Dealer runs an exclusive shop behind a plain door with peeling green paint. No sign, no marking - you must know to ask for it. They trade in magical items and information about legendary weapons.

Appearance

  • Build: Small, hunched
  • Clothing: Wrapped in layers of grey cloth
  • Distinctive: Fingers too long, too many joints
  • Voice: Rasping, irritated

The Green Door

Location: Kennels District, Crownfall. Three streets past the Broken Mug tavern.

A plain door with peeling green paint. No sign, no marking. A slot at eye level opens first. Four locks must be undone. Inside: a single cramped room, every surface covered with magical items - shelves of vials, racks of wands, rings, amulets, stones that glow or pulse or breathe.

Party Transactions

Sol Raven's Purchase

  • Cloak of Protection - 280gp (haggled down from 350gp)
  • +1 to AC and saving throws, simple grey wool

Jonas's Purchase

  • Folio: Location of Oathbreaker's End - 200gp
  • The Hollow, 3 days southeast of Crownfall

Quotes

"What."
"Legendary items don't sit on shelves, waiting to be bought. They are FOUND. Taken. Inherited. Pried from dead hands in places where dead hands still grasp."

items.title: Vela Thorne
items.content:
Vela Thorne

Overview

The Rescued Archivist Status: Fled Veinspire Former Position: Junior Archivist, Mareathan Church Location: En route to Crownfall with Seraphine Vale

Vela Thorne was a junior archivist who discovered Kaleth Vorn's kill list. Captured and used as bait, she was rescued by the party and witnessed Mira's Undying Conviction.

Appearance

A young woman in her late twenties or early thirties â€” hard to tell under the bruises. Her robes were once the white-and-crimson of a Mareathan initiate, but they're torn now, stained with blood and tunnel-filth. Pale grey eyes, bloodshot from weeks of captivity. Dark circles beneath them. Hands that tremble when she's not actively using them.

She moves like someone who expects to be hit.

Personality

  • Traumatized â€” weeks of torture leave marks
  • Intelligent â€” still an archivist at heart, still curious
  • Fragile â€” flinches at sudden movements, doesn't sleep well
  • Determined â€” refuses to be useless
  • Awed â€” has seen things that reshape worldviews

Background

The Discovery

Vela was a junior archivist in the Mareathan Church â€” low-ranking, unremarkable, invisible. Until she found Kaleth Vorn's manifest.

A list of names spanning thirty years. All labeled "Resolved â€” Tribunal Authority." She started matching them to death records. Accident reports. Travel incidents.

None of them were accidents.

Capture

Kaleth caught her with the manifest. Instead of killing her, he smiled. Asked what she thought she'd found. Asked if she understood what heresy really meant.

Then he used her as bait.

"He said I'd make good bait. That the last name on his list would come for me eventually. That heretics can't resist saving people."

She was tortured. Questioned. Bound with blood-treated manacles. Kept barely alive for weeks, waiting for Mira Alethain to come.

Rescue

The party killed her captors and freed her. She witnessed Mira's Undying Conviction â€” watched a woman wreathed in orange fire dismember nine people in under a minute.

Relationships

Character Relationship
Mira Alethain Awe and terror. Watched her kill nine people. Also watched her weep for her husband.
Fursen Provided answers about his people. Respects his composure.
Jonas Cautious. He's branded by a Sovereign.
Sol Raven Unsettled. He's undead. But he was kind.
Seraphine Vale Traveling companion. Both fled the Church.

What They Know

  • The catacombs beneath Veinspire â€” layout, sealed areas, hidden passages
  • Pre-Usurpation history â€” more than most archivists
  • The Leonin extinction â€” unofficial version
  • The sealed vaults â€” where they are, why the Church couldn't open them
  • Kaleth Vorn's methods â€” firsthand experience

Key Moments

The Skin-Walker's Feast

  • Rescued from Tribunal guards
  • Provided information about Kaleth's trap
  • Explained Leonin history to Fursen
  • Led party to sealed pre-Usurpation vault
  • Witnessed the Chamber of the Final Breath

Departure

Fled Veinspire with Seraphine Vale, heading to Crownfall.

Quotes

"They say a lot of things." â€” On Church doctrine about heretics

"I don't have anywhere else to go now anyway." â€” On joining the party

"The official histories say the Leonin crime was 'defying divine authority.' But I think the real crime was simpler. You remembered the truth. And that terrified him." â€” To Fursen

items.title: Velara Ashyn
items.content:
Velara Ashyn

Overview

Velara Ashyn was once Kaedris's favorite â€” her consort, her lover. She stole the original passion-seed to prevent Kaedris from burning the world. She's been trapped in a soul anchor amulet for five hundred years, waiting.

Appearance

Velara's physical form is long dead. Her soul persists in the Soul Anchor Amulet:

  • Dull metal, tarnished green
  • Pulses with a heartbeat rhythm
  • Grows cold when approaching the Bastion's influence

Personality

  • Grateful â€” to finally be found after 500 years
  • Terrified â€” of returning to the Bastion
  • Desperate â€” to reach Crownfall and the Docent
  • Exhausted â€” after 500 years of imprisonment
  • Hopeful â€” for the first time in centuries

Background

Kaedris's Consort

Velara lived in the Heartspire at the center of the Bastion of Fireblood. She loved Kaedris. And Kaedris loved her â€” as much as something like the Sovereign of Passion can love.

But Velara saw what Kaedris was becoming. What she wanted to become.

The Discovery

Kaedris found a way to amplify her power â€” to make the whole world feel as she does. She began breeding passion-seeds, fragments of concentrated emotion harvested from Aedwynn's heart.

One seed can ignite a city. A hundred could burn the world.

The Theft

Velara stole the original â€” the first passion-seed, the one Kaedris cut from Aedwynn's heart with her own hands. Without it, the others are just echoes. With it, Kaedris could finish what she started.

Velara ran. Five hundred years ago.

The Flight

Velara hired the Morrow Trading Company to take her far from the Bastion. Her contract specified no stops in Sovereign-controlled territory.

Kaedris sent something to retrieve what was stolen. A shape in the heat shimmer. A woman â€” or something wearing a woman's shape. Beautiful. Burning. Feet that left glass in the dirt.

She found the caravan in the Unclaimed. Everyone burned from the inside out. Velara was already dead when the burning woman arrived. The soul anchor amulet preserved her consciousness.

She's been trapped ever since. Five hundred years. Watching the caravan rot. Waiting.

Relationships

Character Relationship
Kaedris Former lover â€” stolen from, now hunted by
Sol Raven Current holder of her amulet â€” can communicate with her
The Party Found her in the Bone Field

What They Know

About Kaedris:
  • Former mortal: A poet. A lover. Felt things so deeply the world couldn't contain them.
  • Claimed Aedwynn's heart during the Usurpation
  • The Bastion isn't a place â€” it's literally her heart
  • She feels everything that enters her domain
  • She's been looking for the passion-seed for 500 years
About the Passion-Seed:
  • A fragment of Aedwynn's heart, crystallized emotion
  • Kaedris can grow them â€” breed them
  • One seed can ignite a city
  • A hundred could burn the world
  • The original (which Velara stole) is the template â€” without it, the others are echoes
  • Cannot be destroyed â€” fire, blade, magic, nothing works
  • It responds to emotion, amplifies it
  • Don't feel strongly near it

Key Moments

Discovery in the Bone Field

The party found Velara in the Bone Field â€” a valley containing hundreds of skeletons (the Morrow caravan and its guards).

First Contact:
  • Jonas lifted the amulet; the corpse grabbed his wrist
  • "...don't... take it... to... her..."
  • The body crumbled to dust
Sol's Communion:
  • Sol communicated with the trapped soul
  • Learned her identity, her history, her request
  • She recognized Sol isn't alive but isn't empty: "...there's something inside you too..."

Her Reaction to the Party's Destination

When told they're heading to the Bastion of Fireblood, Velara recoiled. Terror. Desperation.

"...she'll feel me the moment I cross the border..."

"...if you take me there... she'll unmake me... and she'll unmake you for bringing me back..."

Requests

  1. Take her to the Docent's Archive â€” neutral ground, outside Kaedris's reach
  2. Don't take the passion-seed to the Bastion â€” Kaedris will feel it the moment it crosses the border
  3. Ask the Docent what to do with the seed

Quotes

"...she loved me once... before I ran..."

"...stole something... couldn't let her have it... couldn't let her burn the world with it..."

"...the Bastion isn't a place... it's her heart... literally her heart... she feels everything that enters..."

items.title: Velvet Thorn
items.content:
Velvet Thorn

Overview

The Innkeeper Profession: Innkeeper, Information Broker Location: The Velvet Thorn Inn, Coin District, Crownfall Status: Active

Velvet Thorn has run her establishment for 31 years. She has deep connections throughout the Unclaimed and maintains contacts in Veinspire, including Thessaly.

Appearance

A woman in her late fifties to early sixties who has aged into authority rather than frailty.

  • Build: Tall, composed, moves with deliberate grace
  • Hair: Silver-white, pulled back severely from her face
  • Face: Sharp cheekbones, deep-set eyes that miss nothing
  • Dress: Deep crimson velvet gown with high collar
  • Accessory: Single silver thorn-shaped brooch at her throat
  • Voice: Like aged whiskey â€” smooth, warm, with something sharp beneath

Personality

  • Composed: Nothing surprises her; she's seen everything
  • Assessing: Constantly reading people, calculating risks and opportunities
  • Discreet: Names don't go in her ledger unless clients want them there
  • Professional: Runs a clean establishment with clear rules
  • Connected: Knows Thessaly from Veinspire; has contacts throughout the Unclaimed

Background

The Velvet Thorn Inn:
  • Four-story building of dark wood and red stone
  • Sign: A rose wrapped in thorns, painted in silver and crimson
  • Red lanterns flank the entrance
  • Doorman the size of a small bear
Clientele:
  • Merchants in fine clothes
  • Sellswords in worn leather
  • People with money and secrets
  • Gray-cloaked professionals
Services:
  • Rooms (various quality levels)
  • Private dining rooms
  • Information (for the right price)
  • Discretion (included)

What They Know

About Seraphine Vale:
  • Arrived 12 days before the party with a young woman (Vela Thorne)
  • Stayed two nights, paid in gold
  • Spent a day at the Docent's Archive
  • Came back "looking like she'd seen a ghost"
  • Asked about routes to skirt the Bastion's border
  • Left through the southern gate
About the Bleeding Blade:
  • Recognizes it as dangerous â€” "hungry"
  • Can feel it "like standing near an open furnace"
  • Warned Jonas about the curse

Relationships

Thessaly

Connected through Veinspire contacts. Thessaly's clay token grants one night's accommodation.

The Party

  • Recognized Thessaly's token immediately
  • Provided one night's accommodation
  • Arranged private dining
  • Gave information about Seraphine Vale
  • Will receive word when Broma completes Jonas's shield commission

Quotes

"She doesn't send people to me lightly. And she doesn't send them at all unless they're either very useful or very desperate. Which are you?" "That's what Thessaly's favor buys you. One night. After that, we talk terms." "That one's hungry. I can feel it from here. Like standing near an open furnace â€” you don't see the heat, but your skin knows." "Make sure you're the one holding it â€” and not the other way around."
